properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall is expected over some areas. Total snowfall: 4 to 8 cm, except 20 cm inland and over higher terrain. Locations: Terra Nova National Park to Clarenville. Time span: this morning until late this evening. Remarks: A mixture of rain and snow will begin this morning before transitioning to mainly snow this afternoon. The heaviest accumulations will occur inland and over higher elevations with lesser amounts along the coast. The snow is expected to change back to rain over all areas tonight. ### Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-11-22T00:57:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-21T08:58:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3369987022.2019
Area: Clarenville and vicinity, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall tonight into Thursday. Snow will begin tonight over portions of Northwestern Ontario spreading eastward towards the Quebec border by Thursday morning. Snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm are possible by the time the snow ends on Thursday. Areas closer to the shores of Lake Superior may begin as rain and receive less snowfall, particularly areas east of Marathon. There remains uncertainty regarding the exact location of the highest snowfall amounts. Snowfall warnings may be required for some regions. This snowfall is due to a developing low pressure system that will track south of the region. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-21T12:52:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-20T20:53:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1703767108.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A wintry mix of rain and snow is expected. Total rainfall: 30 to 45 mm along the coast. Total snowfall: near 10 cm inland and over higher terrain. Locations: Bonavista and Burin Peninsulas. Time span: this morning until this evening. Remarks: Rain will continue over coastal areas today, but precipitation is forecast to transition to snow inland and over higher terrain later this morning or early this afternoon. The snow will change back to rain this evening. Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions and reduced visibilities in the heavy, wet snow. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-11-22T01:02:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-21T09:03:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0885372000.2019
Area: Burin Peninsula, Bonavista Peninsula

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions will end later this morning. A low pressure system continues to bring snow and blowing snow to the Hudson Bay coast. Winds have strengthened to north 50 or 60 km/h in the area with locally stronger gusts. This has allowed visibilities to drop to 400 metres at Rankin Inlet. Blizzard conditions are expected to improve later this morning as winds gradually diminish. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-21T17:34:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-21T09:30:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4268922047.2019
Area: Rankin Region including Whale Cove
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall is expected over some areas. Total snowfall: 15 to 20 cm. Locations: mainly the Bay d'Espoir Highway area, with lesser amounts elsewhere. Time span: continuing until this evening. Remarks: Snow, heavy at times, will continue over the interior today with significant accumulations likely along the Bay d'Espoir Highway. The highest amounts will occur over elevated terrain. Precipitation will fall mainly as rain along the coast, though may mix with or change to snow this evening. In the Buchans area, precipitation is expected to occur mainly as snow, but with total accumulations less than 10 cm. Conditions will improve over all areas later this evening as the precipitation tapers off. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-11-22T01:00:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-21T09:01:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1698949733.2019
Area: Connaigre, Buchans and the interior
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant accumulations of wet, heavy snowfall are expected. Total snowfall: 15 to 25 cm. Locations: Grand Falls-Windsor to Gander, with highest totals likely occurring in the Gander area. Time span: midday today until midnight tonight. Remarks: Areas of drizzle are expected to transition to snow this morning and become heavy, at times, this afternoon. The snow is forecast to ease to a mix of drizzle and flurries after midnight. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow heavy at times is expected today. Snow will continue near Lake Superior and spread eastward towards the Quebec border later this morning. Snowfall amounts in the 15 to 20 cm range are expected. The snow will taper off from west to east later this afternoon over north of Superior, and through tonight over northeastern Ontario. This snowfall is due to a developing low pressure system that will track south of the region. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Update: High Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Roseau River From Gardenton To Stuartburn
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-11-21T16:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-11-20T14:48:31-06:00, BAA60F0C-34BA-4603-6AEE-543560DDE397
Area: Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. A few hours of freezing rain are expected Thursday night. Ice accretion amounts will range from 2 to 5 millimetres. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: 100 km/h. Locations: Bonavista Peninsula. Time span: midnight tonight until early Friday morning. Remarks: Northeasterly winds will strengthen today with the strongest gusts occurring overnight tonight. Winds will gradually ease on Friday. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 10 cm is expected. A Pacific frontal system is crossing central Yukon this afternoon and tonight, spreading snow heavy at times to the Mayo region. 10 cm of snow can be expected before the snow tapers off overnight as the system moves to the east. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Total rainfall: 40 to 70 mm. Locations: Avalon Peninsula. Time span: this morning until midnight tonight. Remarks: Rain will become heavier today with downpours possible this afternoon and evening. The rain may also mix with snow at times, mainly over northwestern sections of the Avalon Peninsula, where a couple centimetres could accumulate over higher elevations. The rain will ease after midnight tonight. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
